cetus.analysis
Class PointsToAnalysis

java.lang.Object
  cetus.analysis.AnalysisPass
      cetus.analysis.PointsToAnalysis

public class PointsToAnalysis
extends AnalysisPass

The Points-To Analyzer creates intraprocedural pointer relationships for C programs. Pointer variables are variables that store the address-value of a memory location and are said to point-to or reference that memory location. The points-to analyzer implemented here is flow sensitive and hence, provides pointer relationships at every program point i.e. every relevant Statement in the program. Pointer relationships are represented using PointsToDomain and PointsToRel, which make use of different Symbol information to a large extent. Aggregate structures such as arrays are handled conservatively, while struct types are handled more precisely. The analyzer also supports useful, but conservative, information handling for heap-allocated variables.

The analyzer is directly used by the Interprocedural Points-to Analyzer, to provide advanced static-time pointer information. Thus, function calls inside of procedures can be supported during intraprocedural analysis.

The analysis is implemented based on the design described in the following M.S. Thesis:

"A Practical Interprocedural Alias Analysis for an Optimizing/Parallelizing C Compiler", Maryam Emami, 1993.

See Also:
PointsToDomain, PointsToRel, IPPointsToAnalysis

Method Detail

getPassName

public java.lang.String getPassName()
Specified by:
getPassName in class AnalysisPass

start

public void start()
Simple intraprocedural analysis can be run for a procedure that does not have pointers in formal parameters. Use only for simple testing or understanding. Annotates the output source code with pointer-relationship information.

For complete use of points-to information, use interprocedural points-to analysis, which directly uses information generated by the intraprocedural analyzer.

Specified by:
start in class AnalysisPass

getPointsToRelations

protected static java.util.Map getPointsToRelations(IPANode proc_node)
Use during interprocedural points-to analysis to get points-to relations for the current procedure node IPANode. Returns map from each statement in the procedure to points-to relationships at(right before) the statement is executed

Parameters:
proc_node - Procedure Node analyzed for points to information
Returns:
Map from statement to points-to domain
See Also:
PointsToDomain

processBasicAssignment

protected static Domain processBasicAssignment(Expression lhs,
                                               Expression rhs,
                                               Statement stmt,
                                               Domain input)
Core handling of pointer assignment. Uses computation of LHS location, RHS location. GEN and KILL sets are created accordingly for the assignment update, thus providing the OUT domain information.

Parameters:
lhs - Normalized LHS expression in assignment
rhs - Normalized RHS expression in assignment
stmt - Parent IR statement
input - IN domain
Returns:
output OUT domain

normalizePointsTo

protected static Expression normalizePointsTo(Expression e)
In order to simplify points to analysis, normalize the expression that might include pointers, dereferences, access expressions etc.

Parameters:
e - The expression to be normalized
Returns:
Expression with same symbols, but in normalized form

annotatePointsTo

protected static void annotatePointsTo(Traversable t,
                                       java.util.Map pointsto)
Use this to annotate a traversable object with the statement-based points-to relationships identified inside the traversable Annotations are inserted as comments before each statement

Parameters:
t - The traversable to annotate
pointsto - Map from statement to its domain (relationships)

exprToLocation

protected static Symbol exprToLocation(Expression e)
Returns the abstract stack location associated with the given expression. Notice that this method returns null if the given expression does not represent an abstract stack location, e.g., +e, !e, ...,.

isPointer

protected static boolean isPointer(Symbol symbol)
This functionality is specifically provided separately from SymbolTools functionality. We consider variables types for Points-To analysis related symbols such as Deref Symbols as also Abstract Locations, thus providing accurate information to the analyzer. Use only if dealing with these constructs.

Parameters:
symbol -
Returns:
TRUE if the symbol represents a pointer location

normalizePointerArithmetic

protected static Expression normalizePointerArithmetic(Expression e)
Attemps to convert pointer arithmetic expression into an array access if possible. Currently handles simple binary expressions that involve a pointer and an integer value Returns null if unable to handle other cases

Parameters:
e - the input expression.
Returns:
the converted expression or null.

createUniverseMap

protected static java.util.Map createUniverseMap(Traversable t)
API to create a map from Statement to Domain where every statement is assigned the value of Universe Domain.

Parameters:
t - The traversable inside of which this assignment must happen
Returns:
The universe map
